page.title: 18STORY OF A DEMBLEBY FARM.
page.content: The land just grew cadlocks and poppies.This is the way that the first fields of a now prosperous farm were described when a molecatcher used his life savings to buy them in 1936.It was a time of economic depression but the 1939-1945 War together with hard work enabled him to expand rapidly buying in rough grazing and turning it into arable land.His sons worked the land with the latest machinery but little extra labour.They got maximum yields by wise use of fertilisers and removal of hedges.The farm might look like a prairie except for the land undulations and the large stands of trees.Today only one of his sons is left and he has no-one to succeed him on the farm. Cadlocks = Sinapsis arvensis.
